title: Contributing to obisindicators
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to obisindicators
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to obisindicators
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("marinebon/obisindicators", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to obisindicators
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to obisindicators
text: Please note obisindicators project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: obisindicators
text: following function calculates number records, species richness, Simpson index, Shannon index, Hurlbert index (n = 50), Hill numbers cell. Perform calculation species level data: Add cell geometries indicators table (idx):
code: idx <- calc_indicators(occ) library(sf)  grid <- dgcellstogrid(dggs, idx$cell) %>%    st_wrap_dateline() %>%    rename(cell = seqnum) %>%    left_join(     idx,     by = "cell")

title: obisindicators
text: Let’s look resulting indicators map form.
code: # ES(50) gmap_indicator(grid, "es", label = "ES(50)") # Shannon index gmap_indicator(grid, "shannon", label = "Shannon index") # Number of records, log10 scale, Robinson projection (default) gmap_indicator(grid, "n", label = "# of records", trans = "log10") # Number of records, log10 scale, Geographic projection gmap_indicator(grid, "n", label = "# of records", trans = "log10", crs=4326)

title: Regional Diversity
text: Let’s use regional subset South Atlantic full OBIS dataset otherwise available https://obis.org/data/access.

title: Regional Diversity
text: Create ISEA discrete global grid resolution 9 using dggridR package: assign cell numbers occurrence data:
code: dggs <- dgconstruct(projection = "ISEA", topology = "HEXAGON", res = 9) occ$cell <- dgGEO_to_SEQNUM(dggs, occ$decimalLongitude, occ$decimalLatitude)[["seqnum"]]

title: Regional Diversity
text: following function calculates number records, species richness, Simpson index, Shannon index, Hurlbert index (n = 50), Hill numbers cell. Perform calculation species level data: Add cell geometries indicators table (idx):
code: idx <- calc_indicators(occ) # rda <- here::here("data-raw/region_diversity_stop-dgcellstogrid.RData") # save.image(rda) # load(rda) grid <- dgcellstogrid(dggs, idx$cell) %>%    st_wrap_dateline() %>%   rename(cell = seqnum) %>%   left_join(     idx,     by = "cell")

title: Regional Diversity
text: Let’s look resulting indicators map form.
code: # ES(50) gmap_indicator(grid, "es", label = "ES(50)") # Shannon index gmap_indicator(grid, "shannon", label = "Shannon index") # Number of records, log10 scale, Robinson projection (default) gmap_indicator(grid, "n", label = "# of records", trans = "log10") # Number of records, log10 scale, Geographic projection gmap_indicator(grid, "n", label = "# of records", trans = "log10", crs=4326)

title: resolution

what: Create function to make grid, calculate metrics, and plot maps for different resolution grid sizes
title: resolution
code: res_changes <- function(resolution = 9){     dggs <- dgconstruct(projection = "ISEA", topology = "HEXAGON", res = resolution)     occ$cell <- dgGEO_to_SEQNUM(dggs, occ$decimalLongitude, occ$decimalLatitude)[["seqnum"]]     idx <- calc_indicators(occ)    grid <- dgcellstogrid(dggs, idx$cell) %>%      st_wrap_dateline() %>%      rename(cell = seqnum) %>%      left_join(       idx,       by = "cell")    gmap_indicator(grid, "es", label = "ES(50)") }

title: resolution
text: plot res 4, hex areas ~630,000 sq km highest resolution can plot without gaps Central Atlantic Region  plot res 6, hex areas ~70,000 sq km. still see gaps can begin see band high amounts sampling towards bottom can show us sampling needed  plot res 9, hex areas ~2600 sq km, default resolution  plot res 11, hex areas ~288 sq km see large amount gaps throughout South Atlantic get small area

what: Calculate Biodiversity Indicators, including ES50 (Hurlbert index) — calc_indicators
title: Calculate Biodiversity Indicators, including ES50 (Hurlbert index) — calc_indicators
text: Calculate expected number marine species random sample 50 individuals (records)

title: Calculate Biodiversity Indicators, including ES50 (Hurlbert index) — calc_indicators
Calculate Biodiversity Indicators, including ES50 (Hurlbert index) — calc_indicators
text: df data frame unique species observations containing columns: cell, species, records esn expected number marine species

title: Calculate Biodiversity Indicators, including ES50 (Hurlbert index) — calc_indicators
text: Data frame following extra columns: - n: number records sp: species richness - shannon: Shannon index - simpson: Simpson index - es: Hurlbert index (n = 50), .e. expected species 50 samples ES(50) - hill_1: Hill number exp(shannon) - hill_2: Hill number 1/simpson - hill_inf: Hill number 1/maxp

title: Calculate Biodiversity Indicators, including ES50 (Hurlbert index) — calc_indicators
text: expected number marine species random sample 50 individuals (records) indicator marine biodiversity richness. ES50 defined OBIS sum(esi) species following per species calculation: `n - ni >= 50 (n total number records cell ni total number records ith-species) esi = 1 - exp(lngamma(n-ni+1) + lngamma(n-50+1) - lngamma(n-ni-50+1) - lngamma(n+1)) n >= 50 - esi = 1 else - esi = NULL Warning: ES50 assumes individuals randomly distributed, sample size sufficiently large, samples taxonomically similar, samples taken manner.

what: Statically map indicators using ggplot — gmap_indicator
title: Statically map indicators using ggplot — gmap_indicator
text: Statically map indicators using ggplot

title: Statically map indicators using ggplot — gmap_indicator
code: gmap_indicator(   grid,   column = "shannon",   label = "Shannon index",   trans = "identity",       crs = "+proj=robin +lon_0=0 +x_0=0 +y_0=0 +ellps=WGS84 +datum=WGS84 +units=m +no_defs" )

title: Statically map indicators using ggplot — gmap_indicator
text: grid spatial features, e.g. hexagons, plot; requires geometry spatial column column column name indicator; default="shannon" label label show legend trans continuous scales, name transformation object object . Built-transformations include "asn", "atanh", "boxcox", "date", "exp", "hms", "identity" (default), "log", "log10", "log1p", "log2", "logit", "modulus", "probability", "probit", "pseudo_log", "reciprocal", "reverse", "sqrt" "time". See ggplot2::continuous_scale crs coordinate reference system; see sf::st_crs()

title: Statically map indicators using ggplot — gmap_indicator
text: ggplot2 plot

title: obisindicators 0.0.2
text: calc_es50() -> calc_indicators() gmap_metric() -> gmap_indicator() Fixed gmap_indicator() use default Robinson projection. Updated vignettes name changes use “indicators” “metrics”. Supplemented documentation calc_indicators() expected input output columns data frame. Added documentation occ_fk occ_1960s occ_2010s Made generation occ_* datasets reproducible set.seed() sampled versions dataset minimize file size Github data-raw/occ.R.

title: obisindicators 0.0.1
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
